results.title: Gulliver in Lilliput
results.brief_description: This enthralling production, using the intricacies of colour separation overlay, captures all the magic and humour of Swift’s brilliant spoof on the follies of mankind. “Gulliver’s Travels” has been a bestseller since it was first published over 250 years ago and tells the story of Gulliver’s adventures among the tiny Lilliputians who are obsessed by petty rivalries and trivia. It is both a timeless political satire and a fascinating tale of extraordinary travels in strange lands, which can be enjoyed by both adults and children. The adaptation is tight and amusing and the special effects really are something. Rated: G

results.title: Gulfstream
results.creator_credit: Bruce Mackay, William Hansen and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A beautifully photographed film that records a sailing expedition through the Gulf Stream in the North Atlantic sea. The changing weather patterns are discussed and the many species of animals, that inhabit the waters, are examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Mackay, William Hansen and ONF | NFB

results.title: Guitar: From stone age through solid rock
results.creator_credit: Lee Mishkin, Nick Bosustow and Xerox Films
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live-action to trace the history of the guitar and to explore the musical styles which the instrument and its ancestors created.

results.title: Guitar Made Easy
results.creator_credit: Hugh Kidd, Marc Gardiner and Paul Fenech
results.brief_description: Mastering the techniques of playing the guitar. Familiarisation, tuning, chord formations, strumming, A & D major and the plectrum method are shown.

results.title: Guitar
results.creator_credit: Barbara Willis Sweete and Niv Fichman
results.brief_description: A vibrant kaleidoscope of Toronto’s International Guitar Festival, “Guitar” meshes dance, mime, visual art and virtuoso performances to create a spectacular and yet intimate celebration of the instrument. For one exciting week the city of Toronto is transformed into the guitar centre of the world. The streets echo with the sounds of the instrument as the great masters from every tradition gather to play for each other - John Williams, Leo Brouwer, Steve Morse to name but a few.

results.title: Guinea pigs is pigs
results.brief_description: Entertaining treatment of bureaucracy at its worst, based on the short story “pigs is pigs” by Ellis parker Butler. A stationmaster, who goes by the rules and insists that “guinea pigs is pigs” and therefore must travel at a higher freight rate than domestic animals, is left to content with a rapidly expanding guinea pig populations and the pater warfare of the railway administration.

results.title: Guilty chimneys
results.brief_description: Deals with the urgent problem of smoke-abatement. The film shows how smoking coal fires not only waste fuel, but also cause dirt and corrosion, and bring about fogs and illness. Various methods of smoke-elimination in the home and industry are outlined, in particular the wider use of gas and coke; and the establishment of new smokeless zone together with extension of existing ones is advocated.
